data.title: Last Night (1998)
data.shortSummary: This poignant dark comedy about the end of the world is a who’s who of the 90s Canadian indie scene

data.title: Farha (2021)
data.shortSummary: A brutal coming-of-age film set at the start of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict

data.title: The Piano Teacher (2001)
data.shortSummary: An unnerving Austrian psychosexual drama from the meticulous auteur Michael Haneke

data.title: Delicatessen (1991)
data.shortSummary: The best synchronized chaotic film you’ll ever see

data.title: A Tale of Two Sisters (2003)
data.shortSummary: A psychological horror film drenched in atmosphere and memorable scares

data.title: Triangle Of Sadness (2022)
data.shortSummary: A fun and messy takedown of the rich

data.title: Lilya 4-ever (2002)
data.shortSummary: A relentlessly bleak odyssey of exploitation, led by tender performances

data.title: The Vanishing (1988)
data.shortSummary: Love, curiosity, and obsession blur when a man’s girlfriend mysteriously disappears

data.title: Bones and All (2022)
data.shortSummary: A classic coming-of-age film with a bloody twist

data.title: The Kings of the World (2022)
data.shortSummary: A knife-sharp account of five kids' journey to land restitution and self-determination

data.title: The Inspection (2022)
data.shortSummary: With knockout performances and a nuanced understanding of its subject matter, The Inspection serves as a necessary testimony of what it’s like to join an old-school institution in a new age

data.title: Dogtooth (2009)
data.shortSummary: The cat is the most feared animal there is!

data.title: Happening (2021)
data.shortSummary: Set nearly 60 years ago, this realistically harrowing abortion drama still rings true today

data.title: Aftersun (2022)
data.shortSummary: A daughter tries to understand her troubled father in Charlotte Wells' heart-wrenching debut feature

data.title: Vortex (2021)
data.shortSummary: A haunting ode to love, death, and everything in between

data.title: All Quiet on the Western Front (2022)
data.shortSummary: A stunning and sobering World War I drama from Germany

data.title: Barbarian (2022)
data.shortSummary: A darkly funny and impossible-to-predict midnight thriller with lots of things on its mind

data.title: Thirst (2009)
data.shortSummary: In this vampire film, a priest is forced to leave his ascetic lifestyle in search of a cure for a deadly virus

data.title: The Death of Mr. Lazarescu (2005)
data.shortSummary: A quiet kafkaesque nightmare lashing out at an inhumane healthcare system

data.title: The Nightingale (2018)
data.shortSummary: An unsettling but important social horror from the director of The Babadook

data.title: Rewind (2020)
data.shortSummary: A harrowing account of child abuse and a family's role in sustaining or preventing it

data.title: To Leslie (2022)
data.shortSummary: A humane portrait of poverty and addiction

data.title: Till (2022)
data.shortSummary: The latest entry in a long line of social issue dramas, Till stands out for its nuanced blend of intimacy and universality

data.title: Grave of the Fireflies (1988)
data.shortSummary: A heartwrenching look at war and the toll it takes on one's humanity

data.title: Red Rocket (2021)
data.shortSummary: A beautiful but heartbreaking look at life in the heartland

data.title: Just Another Love Story (2007)
data.shortSummary: A Danish thriller about a mid-life crisis that goes wrong

data.title: Playground (2021)
data.shortSummary: An unfiltered account of the darker side of childhood

data.title: On the Count of Three (2021)
data.shortSummary: A darkly comic tale following two best friends on the last day of their lives

data.title: I Am Jonas
data.shortSummary: An atmospheric French coming-of-age drama

data.title: Brazil (1985)
data.shortSummary: A grand journey where reality and fantasy collide

data.title: Burning (2018)
data.shortSummary: The Complex South-Korean Award-Sweeper

data.title: Little Shop of Horrors (1986)
data.shortSummary: A deliriously entertaining horror-comedy musical with some of the best puppetry put on film

data.title: Han Gong-ju (2013)
data.shortSummary: A bitter story about school, friendship, and life

data.title: Ratcatcher (1999)
data.shortSummary: A haunting, dreamlike character study set in a dead-end Glasgow neighborhood

data.title: Three Minutes: A Lengthening (2022)
data.shortSummary: A haunting but moving elegy about loss and memory

data.title: Welcome to the Dollhouse (1995)
data.shortSummary: A painfully realistic coming-of-age tale

data.title: The Promise (1996)
data.shortSummary: A gritty, realist thriller and a bitter coming-of-age tale all in one

data.title: Re-Animator (1985)
data.shortSummary: A bloody and campy cult horror classic that fully embraces its B-movie premise

data.title: Retablo (2017)
data.shortSummary: A quiet but potent coming-of-age drama

data.title: Ringu (1998)
data.shortSummary: The iconic but still underseen Japanese horror mystery that's smarter than you remember

data.title: Babyteeth (2020)
data.shortSummary: A quirky romance with a dark underbelly

data.title: Bacurau (2019)
data.shortSummary: A fantasy drama about a peculiar Brazilian town

data.title: Waltz with Bashir (2008)
data.shortSummary: An unflinching film that blends genre and form to effectively deliver its anti-war message

data.title: Wild Tales (2014)
data.shortSummary: Co-produced by Pedro Almodóvar, this tumultuous Argentine anthology film tests the limits of human sanity when pushed to the extremes – and will also test yours.

data.title: The Lighthouse (2019)
data.shortSummary: Impeccably-acted if not too weird of a movie

data.title: Living in Oblivion (1995)
data.shortSummary: This snarky take on indie filmmaking features some familiar faces

data.title: In Order of Disappearance (2014)
data.shortSummary: Norwegian Kill Bill

data.title: Uncut Gems (2019)
data.shortSummary: On-brand anxiety-inducing thrills from the Safdie Brothers

data.title: Jim & Andy: The Great Beyond – Featuring a Very Special, Contractually Obligated Mention of Tony Clifton (2017)
data.shortSummary: Watch Jim Carrey take method acting to the extreme as he transforms into his idol Andy Kaufmann.

data.title: The Woman Who Left (2016)
data.shortSummary: A Golden Lion-winning moralistic tale from slow cinema master Lav Diaz

data.title: Border (2018)
data.shortSummary: Swedish folklore and a thrilling script

data.title: Cure (1997)
data.shortSummary: A series of mysterious murders leads a detective to a former psychological student

data.title: C’mon C’mon (2021)
data.shortSummary: Lines are blurred between childhood and parenthood in this slow but lovely film

data.title: Prophet’s Prey (2015)
data.shortSummary: An incisive documentary on Fundamentalist Latter Day Saints cult leader Warren Jeffs

data.title: The Tribe (2014)
data.shortSummary: No subtitles, no translation, just Ukranian sign language and a downward spiral into violence

data.title: A Sun (2019)
data.shortSummary: A searing but poetic drama about class and family set in modern Taiwan

data.title: Frantz (2016)
data.shortSummary: A post-war romance hinged on mystery and politics

data.title: Four Lions (2010)
data.shortSummary: A dark comedy about failed British terrorists that mixes accuracy with hilariousness

data.title: The Sea Inside (2004)
data.shortSummary: Javier Bardem delivers a stellar performance as a quadriplegic struggling for the right to end his life.

data.title: I Don’t Feel at Home in This World Anymore (2017)
King of Devil’s Island (2011)
data.shortSummary: Stellan Skarsgard delivers the goods in a bleak historical drama

data.title: Icarus (2017)
data.shortSummary: An Academy-Award-winning documentary that set out to explore performance-enhancing drugs before stirring up a hornet's nest

data.title: The Act of Killing (2012)
data.shortSummary: A daring, surreal, and thoroughly bone-chilling documentary about the genocide in Indonesia

headline: Popular + Dark
subtitle: Find the best dark movies to watch, from our mood category. Like everything on agoodmovietowatch, these dark movies are highly-rated by both viewers and critics.
